bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Wallace H. Graham, July 23, [1950]

div1.p: Hench informs Graham of Emilie Lawrence Reed's death, and suggests that President Truman and Surgeon General Bliss send condolences to Lawrence Reed.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Wallace H. Graham, July 23, [1950]
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
1206
Send the following message, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
GENERAL WALLACE GRAHAM WHITE HOUSE
WASHINGTON DC
div1.p:
MRS WALTER REED DIED BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT PENN THIS SUNDAY MORNING
AGED OVER 90. BURIAL ARLINGTON TUESDAY 330. FEW WASHINGTONIANS
REALIZED SHE WAS STILL LIVING. SINCE WALTER REED STILL ARMYS CHIEF
MEDICAL HERO MAY I RESPECTFULLY SUGGEST THAT PRESIDENT TRUMAN OR YOU
IN HIS NAME, ALSO SURGEON GENERAL BLISS SEND MESSAGES TO REED'S
DISTINGUSHED SON MAJOR GENERAL WALTER L REED 2810 36TH PLACE N.W.,
WASHINGTON AND TO DAUGHTER BLOSSOM REED, BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT, THIS YEAR
FIFIETH ANNIVERSARY REED'S DISCOVERY.
div1.closer:
DR PHILIP S HENCH COPY OF WIRE SENT JULY 23RD
C
